00041 // DEBUGGING MACROS:
00042 //
00043 // DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG)
00044 //     MSG  = message to print
00045 //     NAME = name that must match the process for the message to print, or
00046 //            null if the message should be printed unconditionally.
00047 //     P    = pointer to process message is for, or NULL in which case the
00048 //            message will not print.
00049 #if 0
00050 #   include <cstring>
00051 #   define DEBUG_NAME ""
00052 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG) \
00053     { \
00054         if ( P && ( (std::strlen(NAME)==0) || !std::strcmp(NAME,P->name())) ) \
00055           std::cout << "**** " << sc_time_stamp() << " ("  \
00056                     << sc_get_current_process_name("** NONE **") << "): " << MSG \
00057                     << " - " << P->name() << std::endl; \
00058     }
00059 #else
00060 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG)
00061 #endif

00092 //==============================================================================
00093 // sc_thread_process -
00094 //
00095 //==============================================================================
00096 class sc_thread_process : public sc_process_b {
00097     friend void sc_thread_cor_fn( void* );
00098     friend void sc_set_stack_size( sc_thread_handle, std::size_t );
00099     friend class sc_event;
00100     friend class sc_join;
00101     friend class sc_module;
00102     friend class sc_process_b;
00103     friend class sc_process_handle;
00104     friend class sc_process_table;
00105     friend class sc_simcontext;
00106     friend class sc_runnable;
00107     friend sc_cor* get_cor_pointer( sc_process_b* process_p );
00108 
00109     friend void wait( int, sc_simcontext* );
00110     friend void wait( sc_simcontext* );
00111     friend void wait( const sc_event&, sc_simcontext* );
00112     friend void wait( const sc_event_or_list&, sc_simcontext* );
00113     friend void wait( const sc_event_and_list&, sc_simcontext* );
00114     friend void wait( const sc_time&, sc_simcontext* );
00115     friend void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event&, sc_simcontext* );
00116     friend void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event_or_list&, sc_simcontext* );
00117     friend void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event_and_list&, sc_simcontext*);
00118   public:
00119     sc_thread_process( const char* name_p, bool free_host,
00120         SC_ENTRY_FUNC method_p, sc_process_host* host_p,
00121         const sc_spawn_options* opt_p );
00122 
00123     virtual const char* kind() const
00124         { return "sc_thread_process"; }
00125 
00126   protected:
00127     // may not be deleted manually (called from sc_process_b)
00128     virtual ~sc_thread_process();
00129 
00130     virtual void disable_process(
00131         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00132     virtual void enable_process(
00133         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00134     virtual void kill_process(
00135         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00136     sc_thread_handle next_exist();
00137     sc_thread_handle next_runnable();
00138     virtual void prepare_for_simulation();
00139     virtual void resume_process(
00140         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00141     void set_next_exist( sc_thread_handle next_p );
00142     void set_next_runnable( sc_thread_handle next_p );
00143 
00144     void set_stack_size( std::size_t size );
00145     inline void suspend_me();
00146     virtual void suspend_process(
00147         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00148     virtual void throw_reset( bool async );
00149     virtual void throw_user( const sc_throw_it_helper& helper,
00150         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00151 
00152     bool trigger_dynamic( sc_event* );
00153     inline void trigger_static();
00154 
00155     void wait( const sc_event& );
00156     void wait( const sc_event_or_list& );
00157     void wait( const sc_event_and_list& );
00158     void wait( const sc_time& );
00159     void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event& );
00160     void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event_or_list& );
00161     void wait( const sc_time&, const sc_event_and_list& );
00162     void wait_cycles( int n=1 );
00163 
00164   protected:
00165     void add_monitor( sc_process_monitor* monitor_p );
00166     void remove_monitor( sc_process_monitor* monitor_p);
00167     void signal_monitors( int type = 0 );
00168 
00169   protected:
00170     sc_cor*                          m_cor_p;        // Thread's coroutine.
00171     std::vector<sc_process_monitor*> m_monitor_q;    // Thread monitors.
00172     std::size_t                      m_stack_size;   // Thread stack size.
00173     int                              m_wait_cycle_n; // # of waits to be done.
00174 
00175   private: // disabled
00176     sc_thread_process( const sc_thread_process& );
00177     const sc_thread_process& operator = ( const sc_thread_process& );
00178 
00179 };

00181 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00182 //"sc_thread_process::set_stack_size"
00183 //
00184 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00185 inline void sc_thread_process::set_stack_size( std::size_t size )
00186 {
00187     sc_assert( size );
00188     m_stack_size = size;
00189 }
00190 
00191 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00192 //"sc_thread_process::suspend_me"
00193 //
00194 // This method suspends this object instance in favor of the next runnable
00195 // process. Upon awakening we check to see if an exception should be thrown.
00196 // There are two types of exceptions that can be thrown, synchronous reset
00197 // and asynchronous reset. At a future time there may be more asynchronous
00198 // exceptions.  If an asynchronous reset is seen and there is not static reset
00199 // specified, or the static reset is not active then clear the throw
00200 // type for the next time this method is called.
00201 //
00202 // Notes:
00203 //   (1) For an explanation of how the reset mechanism works see the top of
00204 //       the file sc_reset.cpp.
00205 //   (2) The m_sticky_reset field is used to handle synchronous resets that
00206 //       are enabled via the sc_process_handle::sync_reset_on() method. These
00207 //       resets are not generated by a signal, but rather are modal by
00208 //       method call: sync_reset_on() - sync_reset_off().
00209 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00210 inline void sc_thread_process::suspend_me()
00211 {
00212     // remember, if we're currently unwinding
00213     bool unwinding_preempted = m_unwinding;
00214 
00215     sc_simcontext* simc_p = simcontext();
00216     sc_cor*         cor_p = simc_p->next_cor();
00217 
00218     // do not switch, if we're about to execute next (e.g. suicide)
00219 
00220     if( m_cor_p != cor_p )
00221     {
00222         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME , this, "suspending thread");
00223         simc_p->cor_pkg()->yield( cor_p );
00224         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME , this, "resuming thread");
00225     }
00226 
00227     // IF THERE IS A THROW TO BE DONE FOR THIS PROCESS DO IT NOW:
00228     //
00229     // (1) Optimize THROW_NONE for speed as it is the normal case.
00230     // (2) If this thread is already unwinding then suspend_me() was
00231     //     called from the catch clause to throw an exception on another
00232     //     process, so just go back to the catch clause.
00233 
00234     if ( m_throw_status == THROW_NONE ) return;
00235 
00236     if ( m_unwinding ) return;
00237 
00238     switch( m_throw_status )
00239     {
00240       case THROW_ASYNC_RESET:
00241       case THROW_SYNC_RESET:
00242         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME , this, "throwing reset for");
00243         if ( m_reset_event_p ) m_reset_event_p->notify();
00244         throw sc_unwind_exception( this, true );
00245 
00246       case THROW_USER:
00247         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME, this, "invoking throw_it for");
00248         m_throw_status = m_active_areset_n ? THROW_ASYNC_RESET :
00249                                           (m_active_reset_n ? THROW_SYNC_RESET :
00250                                           THROW_NONE);
00251         m_throw_helper_p->throw_it();
00252         break;
00253 
00254       case THROW_KILL:
00255         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME, this, "throwing kill for");
00256         throw sc_unwind_exception( this, false );
00257 
00258       default: // THROWING_NOW
00259         if( !unwinding_preempted )
00260             SC_REPORT_FATAL( SC_ID_INTERNAL_ERROR_
00261                            , "unexpected unwinding/throw status" );
00262         // may continue, if suppressed
00263         m_throw_status = THROW_NONE;
00264         DEBUG_MSG( DEBUG_NAME, this, "restarting thread");
00265         break;
00266     }
00267 }

00270 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00271 //"sc_thread_process::wait"
00272 //
00273 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00274 inline
00275 void
00276 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_event& e )
00277 {
00278     if( m_unwinding )
00279         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00280 
00281     m_event_p = &e; // for cleanup.
00282     e.add_dynamic( this );
00283     m_trigger_type = EVENT;
00284     suspend_me();
00285 }
00286 
00287 inline
00288 void
00289 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00290 {
00291     if( m_unwinding )
00292         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00293 
00294     el.add_dynamic( this );
00295     m_event_list_p = &el;
00296     m_trigger_type = OR_LIST;
00297     suspend_me();
00298 }
00299 
00300 inline
00301 void
00302 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_event_and_list& el )
00303 {
00304     if( m_unwinding )
00305         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00306 
00307     el.add_dynamic( this );
00308     m_event_list_p = &el;
00309     m_event_count = el.size();
00310     m_trigger_type = AND_LIST;
00311     suspend_me();
00312 }
00313 
00314 inline
00315 void
00316 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_time& t )
00317 {
00318     if( m_unwinding )
00319         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00320 
00321     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00322     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00323     m_trigger_type = TIMEOUT;
00324     suspend_me();
00325 }
00326 
00327 inline
00328 void
00329 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00330 {
00331     if( m_unwinding )
00332         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00333 
00334     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00335     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00336     e.add_dynamic( this );
00337     m_event_p = &e;
00338     m_trigger_type = EVENT_TIMEOUT;
00339     suspend_me();
00340 }
00341 
00342 inline
00343 void
00344 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00345 {
00346     if( m_unwinding )
00347         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00348 
00349     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00350     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00351     el.add_dynamic( this );
00352     m_event_list_p = &el;
00353     m_trigger_type = OR_LIST_TIMEOUT;
00354     suspend_me();
00355 }
00356 
00357 inline
00358 void
00359 sc_thread_process::wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00360 {
00361     if( m_unwinding )
00362         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00363 
00364     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00365     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00366     el.add_dynamic( this );
00367     m_event_list_p = &el;
00368     m_event_count = el.size();
00369     m_trigger_type = AND_LIST_TIMEOUT;
00370     suspend_me();
00371 }
00372 
00373 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00374 //"sc_thread_process::wait_cycles"
00375 //
00376 // This method suspends this object instance for the specified number of cycles.
00377 // A cycle is defined as the event the thread is set up to staticly wait on.
00378 // The field m_wait_cycle_n is set to one less than the number of cycles to
00379 // be waited for, since the value is tested before being decremented in
00380 // the simulation kernel.
00381 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00382 inline
00383 void
00384 sc_thread_process::wait_cycles( int n )
00385 {
00386     if( m_unwinding )
00387         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_DURING_UNWINDING_, name() );
00388 
00389     if( n <= 0 )
00390         SC_REPORT_ERROR( SC_ID_WAIT_NEGATIVE_CYCLES_, name() );
00391 
00392     m_wait_cycle_n = n-1;
00393     suspend_me();
00394 }
00395 
00396 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00397 //"sc_thread_process::miscellaneous support"
00398 //
00399 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00400 inline
00401 void sc_thread_process::add_monitor(sc_process_monitor* monitor_p)
00402 {
00403     m_monitor_q.push_back(monitor_p);
00404 }
00405 
00406 
00407 inline
00408 void sc_thread_process::remove_monitor(sc_process_monitor* monitor_p)
00409 {
00410     int mon_n = m_monitor_q.size();
00411 
00412     for ( int mon_i = 0; mon_i < mon_n; mon_i++ )
00413     {
00414     if  ( m_monitor_q[mon_i] == monitor_p )
00415         {
00416             m_monitor_q[mon_i] = m_monitor_q[mon_n-1];
00417             m_monitor_q.resize(mon_n-1);
00418         }
00419     }
00420 }
00421 
00422 inline
00423 void sc_thread_process::set_next_exist(sc_thread_handle next_p)
00424 {
00425     m_exist_p = next_p;
00426 }
00427 
00428 inline
00429 sc_thread_handle sc_thread_process::next_exist()
00430 {
00431     return (sc_thread_handle)m_exist_p;
00432 }
00433 
00434 inline
00435 void sc_thread_process::set_next_runnable(sc_thread_handle next_p)
00436 {
00437     m_runnable_p = next_p;
00438 }
00439 
00440 inline
00441 sc_thread_handle sc_thread_process::next_runnable()
00442 {
00443     return (sc_thread_handle)m_runnable_p;
00444 }
00445 
00446 inline sc_cor* get_cor_pointer( sc_process_b* process_p )
00447 {
00448     sc_thread_handle thread_p = dynamic_cast<sc_thread_handle>(process_p);
00449     return thread_p->m_cor_p;
00450 }
00451 
00452 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00453 //"sc_thread_process::trigger_static"
00454 //
00455 // This inline method adds the current thread to the queue of runnable
00456 // processes if required.  This is the case if the following criteria
00457 // are met:
00458 //   (1) The process is in a runnable state.
00459 //   (2) The process is not already on the run queue.
00460 //   (3) The process is expecting a static trigger,
00461 //       dynamic event waits take priority.
00462 //   (4) The process' static wait count is zero.
00463 //
00464 // If the triggering process is the same process, the trigger is
00465 // ignored as well, unless SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS
00466 // is defined.
00467 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00468 inline
00469 void
00470 sc_thread_process::trigger_static()
00471 {
00472     // No need to try queueing this thread if one of the following is true:
00473     //    (a) it is disabled
00474     //    (b) it is already queued for execution
00475     //    (c) it is waiting on a dynamic event
00476     //    (d) its wait count is not satisfied and it is not currently in reset
00477 
00478     if ( (m_state & ps_bit_disabled) || is_runnable() ||
00479           m_trigger_type != STATIC )
00480         return;
00481 
00482 #if ! defined( SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS )
00483     if( SC_UNLIKELY_( sc_get_current_process_b() == this ) )
00484     {
00485         report_immediate_self_notification();
00486         return;
00487     }
00488 #endif // SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS
00489 
00490     if ( m_wait_cycle_n > 0 && THROW_NONE == m_throw_status )
00491     {
00492         --m_wait_cycle_n;
00493         return;
00494     }
00495 
00496     // If we get here, then the thread has satisfied its wait criteria. If it is
00497     // suspended, then mark its state as ready to run. If it is not suspended,
00498     // then push it onto the runnable queue.
00499 
00500     if ( m_state & ps_bit_suspended )
00501     {
00502         m_state = m_state | ps_bit_ready_to_run;
00503         return;
00504     }
00505 
00506     simcontext()->push_runnable_thread(this);
00507 }
00508
